qas.question: In which year was the London Centre for Nanotechnology established?
The Londre Centre for Nanotechnology was a joint effort between UCL and which college?
What is the old name of the Imperial College Business School?
The Faculties of Life Sciences and Physical Sciences merged in 2005 to become which faculty?
What school was given an award by the Privy Council?
When did the Privy Council give Imperial an award?
What did UCL establish to compete with Imperial College?
What busniss school was funded by the Queen?

plausible_answers.text: the Faculties of Life Sciences and Physical Sciences

qas.question: What two programs developed out of the Faculty of Natural Sciences?

context: In <a1_0><b6_0>2003<b6_0/><a1_0/> <b5_0>Imperial<b5_0/> was granted degree-awarding powers in its own right by the <a0_0>Privy Council<a0_0/>. <b7_0>The London Centre for Nanotechnology<b7_0/> was established in the same year as a joint venture between UCL and <a2_0>Imperial College London<a2_0/>. In 2004 the <a3_0><b8_0>Tanaka Business School<b8_0/><a3_0/> (now named the Imperial College Business School) and a new Main Entrance on Exhibition Road were opened by The Queen. The UK Energy Research Centre was also established in 2004 and opened its headquarters at Imperial College. In November 2005 <b9_0>the Faculties of Life Sciences and Physical Sciences<b9_0/> merged to become the <a4_0>Faculty of Natural Sciences<a4_0/>.
